messages.message:
Hi team, for deployments we have the option of a connected drive for upstream integrations. We can also choose to pull in files whenever new ones are found in the input folder i.e. S3 bucket folder Some feedback/questions I have:
1. How close to real time do we expect this to happen? 
2. I've been trying it out and it looks like 2-3mins lag time between uploading a file and seeing the run in AI Hub. Is there a way to force a refresh or check of the connected drive? (The demo I'm building is for a real-time use case where they will want a fast turnaround time)
3. What if I want to send through a batch of docs? If I upload a folder of docs this doesn't get pulled through (I'd expect them to be pulled through as a batch perhaps?)
4. What if there is already files in the connected drive upon connection? There seems to be a similar lag in this case also

Hey! Our scheduler checks every 3 min for new documents to run. For real time applications, we would advise triggering a run manually using an endpoint such as `api/v2/zero-shot-idp/projects/app/<app_id>/run`. Would that work?

^ That is the wrong endpoint.
You should use the app runs endpoint


The polling interval is */3 in the cron scheduler => it runs at 0th minute, minute 3, minute 6 and so on.  The max delay is 3 minutes.

3. no - we only pull files and skip folders
This is something we can support in the future if needed.
